name: Tomato Ketchup from 'Mastering Fermentation'
description: Would you ever think of making fermented ketchup? I certainly hadn't before pickling up my copy of Mary Karlin's new cookbook, Mastering Fermentation. Yet, after pondering the history of the condiment, it makes a lot of sense.
recipeIngredient: 3 cups canned or homemade tomato paste
1/2 cup raw, unfiltered apple cider vinegar
6 tablespoons robust flavored raw, unfiltered honey such as clover, or organic amber maple syrup
1/4 cup basic whey (from yogurt), water kefir, or vegetable brine (such as from sauerkraut), as fermenting agent

recipeInstructions.text: Combine all the ingredients in a bowl, making sure the salt and the honey are dissolved. Transfer to a wide-mouth 1-quart jar. Secure a piece of cheesecloth to the opening and allow to sit at room temperature for 8 hours or overnight. Remove the cheesecloth and secure an airtight lid. Refrigerate for 2 days before using. Use within 2 months.
